reviews.text: The Maldron Hotel in Tallaght appears to be a nice lodging facility when entering the hotel. The lobby is well kept and the check-in staff friendly, even thought semi efficient. As a middle-class business hotel the looks and first impressions are very positive and modern.
reviews.title: Outside hui, inside pfui

reviews.text: However, the room I was assigned on the first floor was a dump. Though the rooms interior are modern with a fairly sleek design, the room had a stale and worn impression. The balcony of my room was located right under overhang of the hotel next to some poorly shielded dump area (or some form of maintenance facility). Therefore it was a dark and dreary experience. The room was clean, but appeared very used and offered a minimum of amenities. The bathroom offered nothing but cream soap and no shampoo for cleaning, which was far away from what I expected. There was a tea kettle, trousers presser and in-room safe available though. Hot and cold water for the shower took a while to figure out and adjust. Still there was good and very workable wi-fi available in the room.
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.text: The hotel is located in a suburban area of Dublin. Not that great of an area, but there are shops and dining available within walking distance. The hotel is located right opposite of the Tallaght football stadium.
reviews.title: Loved It!

reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was good and sufficient, but the overall restaurant facility appeared quite worn as well, though following a modern design.
reviews.title: Great Service and Value for money

reviews.text: At the rate paid this was a decent value though and what one can expect for €69 a night plus €9.50.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel with brilliant service.....

reviews.text: I live in Lucan and was looking for a good hotel in the areas near by to have my fathers surprise birthday party, booked here after looking at many places and we all had a fantastic time. they gave us a very cheap deal under 1000 euro for 100 pax, lorna was great. on the night the staff were brilliant, we had a bar in the room so it was very convenient. the food was very substantial and there was lots of it. I will go back again, have already recommended it to my aunty's wedding anniversary.
reviews.title: Had a fantastic time celebrating my fathers 40th birthday

reviews.text: We were a party of five who stayed in the Maldron over the weekend of 25 September, booking three rooms.We had not stayed there before and chose the hotel via internet purely because of lack of availability elsewhere in Sth Dublin that weekend and we needed to be within easy reach of a family member's home for a christening.
reviews.title: Well done,Maldron

reviews.text: From initial check in on Fri evening through to check out on Sun morning morning we have nothing but praise for this hotel and its' staff.Deirdre on reception was particularly helpful-two of our party arrived from London on Sat morning at 9.30am and Deirdre was able to allocate them a room on arrival despite the hotel being full on Fri night.
reviews.title: so dissapointed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms were comfortable and spotlessly clean and were welll serviced.Breakfasts were good with no shortage of attentive staff.In particular the flexibility of breakfast availability until 11 am on Sunday was very welcome.
reviews.title: Great value for money - a decent hotel

reviews.text: Overall this hotel offers very good facilities and is great value for money.The staff with whom we came in contact during our stay are second to none in their attention to customer care and are a credit to the hotel.I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel and will definitely go back.
reviews.title: excellent hotel good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good: price, staff, view, close to shopping, free parking, close to public transit
reviews.title: You get what you pay for

reviews.text: Bad: uncomfortable bed, loud, dusty room
reviews.title: I am was happy in your hotel

reviews.text: Terrible: far from city center, Stix restaurant food, dirty carpet
reviews.title: Excellent!! Would recommend to anyone

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was surprised and impressed. Modern, very clean rooms. Very friendly, reliable staff. If necessary, I was served within 5 minutes. Your hotel I will recommend to all my friends. This is the best hotel !!! I look forward to my next visit to your hotel. Good luck!
reviews.title: Absolutely outstanding hotel - clean, friendly, luxurious 10/10

reviews.text: I stayed at the Maldron Hotel Tallaght Feb 2011 and was very suprised at how nice the hotel was. Excellent location (very close to the M50). The hotel staff were extremlely helpful & friendly, considering I was ringing them every 5 minutes for directions!!
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: We were at the Beatles Christmas Party two weeks back and we would just like to say a big thank you to everyone there, you all were fantastic. We booked The Maldron after celebrating our father 60th birthday here a couple of months back, like it was then, the party was just wonderful. The band was fantastic, the food was just wonderful and as we found it to be the lat time, the staff were friendly and would do just about anything for you.
reviews.title: Merry Maldron Christmas & Merry Very Impressive!

reviews.text: Unfortunately one of the waitresses spilled soup over my moms new jacket, but she was so very nice and apologetic, that we felt bad for her, she got the manager and she offered to pay for the drycleaning, which was great. We had booked seeral rooms to stay for the night and went to the residents bar and were there till late. We were very late coming down for breakfast but it was nice they had it open till 11 tht morning and I must say the porridge was the best I have had in a long long time... all in all compliments to the Maldron and Merry Christmas. We will be back in the new year...
reviews.title: Reflects the decline in Ireland

reviews.text: If ever there was a hotel that needs to be busy - this is it. When I've stayed there before back in the good old days of the Celtic Tiger , this was a great hotel. Unfortunately as the customers go down, so do the staff numbers & so does the quality. While everyone tries hard, it just doesn't cut it any more & standards have slipped. Nothing drastic but its the little things you notice - the dirty carpets, the cleanliness, the lack of a breakfast buffet, the lack of staff at check-in, etc. Still the best hotel in Tallaght but could be and has been better
reviews.title: this has to be the worst hotel ever and when i got back i took the ad off the wall in our company.

reviews.text: i stay in this hotel seen a ad in the company i work for last min time out away i thought.was i wrong i stayed in room 206 cig burns on the bed spread dust on the night stand.sink all cracked also cig burns on the carpet put it all together it was like someone had a party the nite before and it was giving a quick clean.no room service and food was bad.my sink was itchy after staying here.i stayed in maldron portlaoise and could say a bad thing about them.i took the ad down off the company would not like anyone who was trying to go away and relax but ended up not happy.i said this as i left i was told the manger would get on to me and didn't hear anything so rang and he seems to be not in each time .quality and costumes are not first on this hotels agenda and without this less and less people will return.i am a very easy going person and am not one to complain but all i can say in all the hotels i have stayed in throughout the years this is the worst i have ever stayed in which is also why i'm mad as this is my first time complaining.normally would let things go
reviews.title: Standards are dropping

reviews.text: This was my 3rd visit to this hotel, and I have to say that the standards are definitley dropping.
reviews.title: Cheap n Cheerful
